intro: Sida sagittifolia, commonly known as arrowleaf sida, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and small, white to pale pink flowers. It typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in coastal areas. Sida sagittifolia is sometimes used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
